election_record.label: New York 1798 State Senate, Western District

overview.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists Thomas R. Gold as "Goold", George Metcalfe as"Metcalf" and Charles Newkirk as"Neukirk".
The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) does not list J. C. Klock or Brown.

"William Beekman, of Schoharie, John Frey and Frederick Gettman of Montgomery, Jacob Morris of Otsego and Thomas R. Gold of Oneida, elected Senators for the Western District", The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 22, 1798

The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 5121 votes for Thomas R. Gold, 4246 votes for John Frey, 3822 votes for Frederick Getman, 2966 votes for Jacob J. Morris, 2647 votes for George Metcalfe, 1388 votes for Charles Newkirk, 2388 votes for Abraham Ten Broeck, but an addition of the totals of the several towns and counties gives the above results.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists 708 votes for Thomas R. Gold and 221 votes for Frederick Getman in Chenango County, but the town totals add up to 788 and 231.
The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 562 votes for George Metcalfe but the town totals add up to 563.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 81 votes for Charles Newkirk in Herkimer County, but the town totals add up to 80.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 418 votes for Thomas R. Gold, 1239 votes for John Frey, 1155 votes for Frederick Getman, 272 votes for Jacob J. Morris, 462 votes for George Metcalfe and 626 votes for Charles Newkirk but the town totals add up to the above results.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists 291 votes for Charles Newkirk in Oneida County, but the town totals add up to 391.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists 515 votes for Thomas R. Gold and 223 votes for William Beekman, but the town totals add up to the above results.

The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 481 votes for John Frey, 482 votes for Frederick Getman, 173 votes for William Beekman, 97 votes for George Metcalfe, 91 votes for Charles Newkird and 207 votes for Abraham Ten Broeck but the town totals add up to the above results.

sub_unit.name: Manilius
sub_unit.note: "The Town of Manlius lost, about 60, Congress and Governor together." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: "Town not named lost - 24 votes, poll list not signed. Bristol also lost - 41 votes, Governor, Senators, Congress, all in one ballot." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 973 votes for Thomas R. Gold but the town totals add up to 1043.

sub_unit.name: Steuben
sub_unit.note: "Middletown 21, and a town, not named, 25 votes, in Steuben County, were lost." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.
The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 21 votes for William Beekman but the town totals add up to 24.
The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 115 votes for Abraham Ten Broeck but the town totals add up to 87.

election_record.reference: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.
